member.name: T:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonProvider
member.summary: The logon provider.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonProvider.Default
member.summary: Use the standard logon provider for the system. The default security provider is negotiate, unless you pass NULL for the domain name and the user name is not in UPN format. In this case, the default provider is NTLM. NOTE: Windows 2000/NT: The default security provider is NTLM.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonProvider.WinNt40
member.summary: Use the NTLM logon provider.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonProvider.WinNt50
member.summary: Use the negotiate logon provider.

member.name: T:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonType
member.summary: The type of logon operation.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonType.Interactive
member.summary: This logon type is intended for users who will be interactively using the computer, such as a user being logged on by a terminal server, remote shell, or similar process. This logon type has the additional expense of caching logon information for disconnected operations; therefore, it is inappropriate for some client/server applications, such as a mail server.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonType.Network
member.summary: This logon type is intended for high performance servers to authenticate plaintext passwords. The function does not cache credentials for this logon type.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonType.Batch
member.summary: This logon type is intended for batch servers, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention. This type is also for higher performance servers that process many plaintext authentication attempts at a time, such as mail or web servers.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonType.Service
member.summary: Indicates a service-type logon. The account provided must have the service privilege enabled.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonType.Unlock
member.summary: This logon type is for GINA DLLs that log on users who will be interactively using the computer. This logon type can generate a unique audit record that shows when the workstation was unlocked. GINAs are no longer supported.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonType.NetworkCleartext
member.summary: This logon type preserves the name and password in the authentication package, which allows the server to make connections to other network servers while impersonating the client. A server can accept plaintext credentials from a client, call , verify that the user can access the system across the network, and still communicate with other servers. NOTE: Windows NT: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authentication.LogonType.NewCredentials
member.summary: This logon type allows the caller to clone its current token and specify new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identifier but uses different credentials for other network connections. This logon type is supported only by the logon provider. NOTE: Windows NT: This value is not supported.

member.summary: List of available privileges.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.AssignPrimaryToken
member.summary: Required to assign the primary token of a process. User Right: Replace a process-level token.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Audit
member.summary: Required to generate audit-log entries. Give this privilege to secure servers. User Right: Generate security audits.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Backup
member.summary:
Required to perform backup operations. This privilege causes the system to grant all read access control to any file, regardless of the access control list (ACL) specified for the file. Any access request other than read is still evaluated with the ACL. This privilege is required by the RegSaveKey and RegSaveKeyEx functions. The following access rights are granted if this privilege is held:
User Right: Back up files and directories.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.ChangeNotify
member.summary: Required to receive notifications of changes to files or directories. This privilege also causes the system to skip all traversal access checks. It is enabled by default for all users. User Right: Bypass traverse checking.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.CreateGlobal
member.summary: Required to create named file mapping objects in the global namespace during Terminal Services sessions. This privilege is enabled by default for administrators, services, and the local system account. User Right: Create global objects.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.CreatePagefile
member.summary: Required to create a paging file. User Right: Create a pagefile.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.CreatePermanent
member.summary: Required to create a permanent object. User Right: Create permanent shared objects.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.CreateSymbolicLink
member.summary: Required to create a symbolic link. User Right: Create symbolic links.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.CreateToken
member.summary: Required to create a primary token. User Right: Create a token object. You cannot add this privilege to a user account with the "Create a token object" policy. Additionally, you cannot add this privilege to an owned process using Windows APIs. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP with SP1 and earlier: Windows APIs can add this privilege to an owned process.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Debug
member.summary: Required to debug and adjust the memory of a process owned by another account. User Right: Debug programs.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.EnableDelegation
member.summary: Required to mark user and computer accounts as trusted for delegation. User Right: Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Impersonate
member.summary: Required to impersonate. User Right: Impersonate a client after authentication.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.IncreaseBasePriority
member.summary: Required to increase the base priority of a process. User Right: Increase scheduling priority.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.IncreaseQuota
member.summary: Required to increase the quota assigned to a process. User Right: Adjust memory quotas for a process.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.IncreaseWorkingSet
member.summary: Required to allocate more memory for applications that run in the context of users. User Right: Increase a process working set.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.LoadDriver
member.summary: Required to load or unload a device driver. User Right: Load and unload device drivers.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.LockMemory
member.summary: Required to lock physical pages in memory. User Right: Lock pages in memory.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.MachineAccount
member.summary: Required to create a computer account. User Right: Add workstations to domain.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.ManageVolume
member.summary: Required to enable volume management privileges. User Right: Manage the files on a volume.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.ProfileSingleProcess
member.summary: Required to gather profiling information for a single process. User Right: Profile single process.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Relabel
member.summary: Required to modify the mandatory integrity level of an object. User Right: Modify an object label.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.RemoteShutdown
member.summary: Required to shut down a system using a network request. User Right: Force shutdown from a remote system.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Restore
member.summary:
Required to perform restore operations. This privilege causes the system to grant all write access control to any file, regardless of the ACL specified for the file. Any access request other than write is still evaluated with the ACL. Additionally, this privilege enables you to set any valid user or group SID as the owner of a file. This privilege is required by the RegLoadKey function. The following access rights are granted if this privilege is held:
User Right: Restore files and directories.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Security
member.summary: Required to perform a number of security-related functions, such as controlling and viewing audit messages. This privilege identifies its holder as a security operator. User Right: Manage auditing and security log.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Shutdown
member.summary: Required to shut down a local system. User Right: Shut down the system.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.SyncAgent
member.summary: Required for a domain controller to use the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol directory synchronization services. This privilege enables the holder to read all objects and properties in the directory, regardless of the protection on the objects and properties. By default, it is assigned to the Administrator and LocalSystem accounts on domain controllers. User Right: Synchronize directory service data.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.SystemEnvironment
member.summary: Required to modify the nonvolatile RAM of systems that use this type of memory to store configuration information. User Right: Modify firmware environment values.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.SystemProfile
member.summary: Required to gather profiling information for the entire system. User Right: Profile system performance.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Systemtime
member.summary: Required to modify the system time. User Right: Change the system time.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.TakeOwnership
member.summary: Required to take ownership of an object without being granted discretionary access. This privilege allows the owner value to be set only to those values that the holder may legitimately assign as the owner of an object. User Right: Take ownership of files or other objects.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Tcb
member.summary: This privilege identifies its holder as part of the trusted computer base. Some trusted protected subsystems are granted this privilege. User Right: Act as part of the operating system.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.TimeZone
member.summary: Required to adjust the time zone associated with the computer's internal clock. User Right: Change the time zone.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.TrustedCredManAccess
member.summary: Required to access Credential Manager as a trusted caller. User Right: Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.Undock
member.summary: Required to undock a laptop. User Right: Remove computer from docking station.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.Authorization.Privilege.UnsolicitedInput
member.summary: Required to read unsolicited input from a terminal device. User Right: Not applicable.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.COM.DirectoryServices.ADDS.DSOPFlag.MultiSelect
member.summary: If this flag is set, the user can select multiple objects. If this flag is not set, the user can select only one object.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.COM.DirectoryServices.ADDS.DSOPFlag.SkipTargetComputerDCCheck
member.summary: If this flag is set and the flag is set in the array, the target computer is always included in the Look in drop-down list. If this flag is not set and the target computer is an up-level or down-level domain controller, the flag is ignored and the target computer is not included in the Look in drop-down list. To save time during initialization, this flag should be set if it is known that the target computer is not a domain controller. However, if the target computer is a domain controller, this flag should not be set because it is better for the user to select domain objects from the domain scope rather than from the domain controller itself.

member.summary: Contains a structure that indicates the types of objects presented to the user for this scope or scopes.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.COM.DirectoryServices.ADDS.DSOPScopeInitInfo.pwzDcName
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated Unicode string that contains the name of a domain controller of the domain to which the target computer is joined. This member is used only if the member contains the flag. If that flag is not set, pwzDcName must be null. This member can be null even if the flag is specified, in which case, the dialog box looks up the domain controller. This member enables you to name a specific domain controller in a multimaster domain. For example, an administrative application might make changes on a domain controller in a multimaster domain, and then open the object picker dialog box before the changes have been replicated on the other domain controllers.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.COM.DirectoryServices.ADDS.DSOPScopeInitInfo.pwzADsPath

member.summary: Contains an value that indicates the status of the specific scope. If the method successfully creates the scope, or scopes, specified by this structure, hr contains . Otherwise, hr contains an error code. If returns , the hr members of all the specified structures also contain .

member.summary: Filter flags to use for an up-level scope, regardless of whether it is a mixed or native mode domain.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.COM.DirectoryServices.ADDS.DSOPUpLevelFilterFlags.flMixedModeOnly
member.summary: Filter flags to use for an up-level domain in mixed mode. Mixed mode refers to an up-level domain that may have Windows NT 4.0 Backup Domain Controllers present. This member can be a combination of the flags listed in the flags. The flag has no affect in a mixed-mode domain because universal security groups do not exist in mixed mode domains.

member.name: F:Wanderer.Library.WindowsApi.COM.DirectoryServices.ADDS.DSOPUpLevelFilterFlags.flNativeModeOnly
member.summary: Filter flags to use for an up-level domain in native mode. Native mode refers to an up-level domain in which all domain controllers are running Windows 2000 and an administrator has enabled native mode operation. This member can be a combination of the flags listed in the flags.
